content.description: <math alttext="2 N O, gas, plus B r 2, gas, react to produce 2 N O B r, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NOBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded></math>
content.question: The two mechanisms in the table below have been proposed for the reaction represented above. Mechanism 1 Mechanism 2 <math alttext="Step 1: N O, gas, plus N O, gas, react to produce N 2 O 2, gas, which is a slow step. Step 2: N 2 O 2, gas, plus B r 2, gas, react to produce 2 N O B r, gas, which is a fast step." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnalign="left left"><mtr><mtd><mi>Step</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><mo> </mo><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mi>s</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>Step</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mo>:</mo><mo> </mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NOBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>t</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></math> <math alttext="Step 1: N O, gas, plus B r 2, gas, react to produce N O B r 2, gas, which is a slow step. Step 2: N O B r 2, gas, plus N O, gas, react to produce 2 N O B r, gas, which is a fast step." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnalign="left right"><mtr><mtd><mi>Step</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><mo> </mo><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mi>NOBr</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mi>s</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>Step</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mo>:</mo><mo> </mo><msub><mi>NOBr</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NOBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>t</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></math> Which of the following observations would support mechanism 1 but not mechanism 2 ?

choices.label: The reaction rate is independent of <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>NO</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>.

The reaction rate is independent of <math alttext="the molar concentration of B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded></math>.
The reaction is second order overall.

content.answer: The reaction rate is independent of <math alttext="the molar concentration of B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
